title: Europeans can't afford the US anymore
summary: Boosted by growth, prices and wages have taken off in the US. The gap with European living standards has never been wider.

title: Depardieu to be tried for sexual assault in October 2024
summary: The 75-year-old actor was questioned on Monday by the Paris judicial police following complaints from two women accusing him of sexual assaults committed in 2021 and 2014.

title: Police break up pro-Palestinian protest at Sorbonne university
summary: Police evacuated dozens of demonstrators from the premises of the Sorbonne in Paris after they had set up tents inside.

title: Pedro Sanchez maneuvers to secure his majority in Spain
summary: Last Wednesday, the prime minister threatened to resign. "I have decided to stay, with even greater strength," he said Monday.

title: At least one-third of European trees not adapted to global warming
summary: Climate change presents a complex challenge for forests: the number of native European species adapted now and up to 2100 will fall sharply, according to a new study.

title: Nadal keeps his clay dream alive as he battles past Cachin
summary: In a dominant first set, Rafael Nadal fired 14 winners and made just nine unforced errors to take the lead in 47 minutes.

title: EU elections: Poll shows far right remains well ahead in France, with Socialists on Macron's heels
summary: Jordan Bardella's Rassemblement National (32%) and Raphaël Glucksmann's left-wing coalition (14%) are gaining voting intentions while the ruling coalition has fallen (17%), in the latest survey carried out by IPSOS in partnership with Le Monde.

title: Columbia talks over Gaza protests collapse
summary: Gaza protesters defied leaving the Ivy League's campus on Monday after the university told demonstrators camped out to leave or face suspension.

title: Scottish First Minister Humza Yousaf resigns
summary: Yousaf stepped down after failing to strike a deal with a breakaway nationalist party whose single seat could have given him a majority in Scotland's devolved regional parliament.

title: Netanyahu fears international arrest warrant from ICC
summary: The Israeli press expects the International Criminal Court to open proceedings against the prime minister, as well as Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and Chief of the General Staff Herzi Halevi.

title: French business school accused of admitting student under sanctions for Myanmar junta ties
summary: The HEC business school accepted the young woman in the summer of 2023, without background checks. Its management maintains that students are selected on the basis of their 'academic excellence,' while referring to the responsibility of banks.

title: World Central Kitchen resumes Gaza work after Israeli strike that killed 7 workers
summary: The nonprofit founded by Spanish-American chef José Andrés said it was going to resume delivering food into the Palestinian enclave.

title: Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez decides not to resign
summary: Sanchez threatened to stand down over what he has denounced as a campaign of political harassment by the right targeting his wife.

title: China's Xi due in France on May 6 for state visit
summary: France's presidency said Emmanuel Macron was planning to discuss the wars in Ukraine and Gaza with his Chinese counterpart.

title: Why are Iran and Israel archenemies?
summary: During the month of April, the two countries traded multiple strikes, marking the first time they entered into direct conflict after 45 years of hostility.

title: First trial of 'Citizens of the Reich' conspiracy opens in Germany
summary: The first hearing, held on April 29, concerns members of the 'military arm' of the group that had dreams of restoring the German Empire of 1871 by force.

title: Japan PM's future hangs in balance after his camp's defeat in by-elections
summary: Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) lost three seats in parliament on April 28. These setbacks further weaken the unpopular prime minister, Fumio Kishida, as he approaches the end of his term as LDP president.

title: Dam bursts in Kenya as death toll from rains and floods continue to rise
summary: At least 42 more people died when the dam burst in Nakuru county, said the local governor.

title: Resignation of First Minister Humza Yousaf deepens crisis within pro-independence Scottish party
summary: In office for barely a year, the Scottish leader triggered his own downfall by singlehandedly bringing down the coalition his party had formed with the Greens in 2021.

title: Taylor Swift's 'Tortured Poets Department' claims top 14 spots on the Billboard 200 chart
summary: The 31-track album has hit No. 1 on the music chart, tying Swift with Jay-Z for second-most No. 1 albums at 14. Only The Beatles, with 19 No. 1 albums, have had more.

title: War in Ukraine: From Mariupol to Odesa, four naval cadets weather the storm
summary: Four young women from Mariupol dreamed of a career in the navy. Burdened by painful memories of the siege in the spring of 2022, they have taken refuge at the prestigious Odesa Maritime Academy, where they are waiting impatiently.
